author: mysanantonio.com
title: Coming attractions
text:
Photo: Warner Bros. Image 1 of / 1 1 Billy Bob Thornton and Sandra Bullock are rivals. Billy Bob Thornton and Sandra Bullock are rivals. Photo: Warner Bros. Coming attractions 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Oct. 30
Burnt: A bad-tempered, full-of-himself chef isn’t exactly a new idea (see “Chef,” “Hell’s Kitchen” and lots more), so it’ll be up to Bradley Cooper to make us care about this former two-star Michelin chef searching for redemption and a third star. Sienna Miller is a fellow chef and possible love interest. Screenwriter Steven Knight has an impressive résumé (“Eastern Promises,” “Locke”).
Our Brand Is Crisis: Sandra Bullock and Billy Bob Thornton portray rival American political consultants on opposite sides of the 2002 presidential campaign — in Bolivia. This may sound far-fetched, but it actually happened. This is Hollywood’s take on a 2005 documentary concerning the campaign strategies of the firm of Greenville Carville (as in James) Shrum that helped swing that election. Bullock’s character works for GCS.
Scouts Guide to the Zombie Apocalypse: Talk about being prepared. Three nerdy Boy Scouts find their skills put to the ultimate test when zombies overrun their town. The Scouts include Tye Sheridan (“Mud”), who’ll be part of another end-of-the-world scenario in 2016 — he’ll play Cyclops in “X-Men: Apocalypse.”
Truth: Robert Redford and Cate Blanchett stars as CBS newsman Dan Rather and producer Mary Mapes in a film that looks into a controversial 2004 piece on “60 Minutes II” that examined George W. Bush ’s time in the Texas Air National Guard during the Vietnam War. It’s based on Mapes’ 2005 book, “Truth and Duty: The Press, the President and the Privilege of Power.”
